intro: Polygonum hydropiper var. glandulosissima, commonly known as the glandular smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive glandular texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense spikes, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist to wet soils, often found in marshy areas, along stream banks, and in wet meadows. Its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed sites make it both an ecological pioneer and a potential invasive species in certain regions.
